description: Redesign the navigation experience with an announcement bar below the header and a dropdown menu that slides down from under the header, replacing the side drawer.

userStories.title: Create AnnouncementBar component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see promotional messages below the header so that I'm aware of current offers.
acceptance: Component created at `apps/website/app/components/AnnouncementBar.tsx`
Same horizontal padding as header (`px-4` mobile, `md:px-6` desktop)
Same max-width as header (`max-w-[600px]`)
Uses `rounded-card` for border radius
Background is `bg-ocher` (#E3B012), text is `text-black font-display text-small`
Centered horizontally like header
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Add marquee animation to AnnouncementBar
userStories.description: As a user, I want the announcement text to scroll continuously so that longer messages fit and create visual interest.
acceptance: Text scrolls smoothly from right to left
Uses CSS animation for infinite horizontal scroll
Duplicate text content creates seamless loop
Uses existing `@keyframes marquee` from theme (30s linear infinite) or similar
Animation loops seamlessly without jumps
Works on both mobile and desktop
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Create NavigationDropdown component structure
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a clean navigation panel when I tap the menu button so that I can browse products and learn more about Wakey.
acceptance: Component created at `apps/website/app/components/NavigationDropdown.tsx`
Two sections: 'Shop' and 'Learn' with items shown immediately (no accordion)
Shop items: 'Wakey Deodorant' → `/products/deodorant`, 'Natural Deodorant' → `/products/natural-deodorant`
Learn items: 'About us' → `/about`, 'FAQ' → `/faq`, 'Blog' → `/blog`
Section labels use `text-body-small font-display uppercase tracking-wide text-black/60`
Nav links use `text-h3 font-display`
Background is `bg-sand`
Same padding as header (`px-4` mobile, `md:px-6` desktop)
Uses `rounded-card` border radius
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Position NavigationDropdown below header
userStories.description: As a user, I want the navigation to appear directly under the header so that it feels like part of the same element.
acceptance: Dropdown positioned in same container/wrapper as header
Appears directly below header with small gap (`mt-2`)
Same max-width as header (`max-w-[600px]`)
Centered horizontally to align with header
When open, dropdown overlays the announcement bar (higher z-index)
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Add slide-down animation to NavigationDropdown
userStories.description: As a user, I want the menu to slide down smoothly so that it feels natural and connected to the header.
acceptance: Menu slides down from under header with smooth animation
Initial state: `opacity-0 -translate-y-4` or similar hidden state
Open state: `opacity-100 translate-y-0`
Uses `ease-out-expo` easing from design system CSS variable
Animation duration 300-400ms
Page content moves down when menu opens (push effect, not overlay)
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Implement menu toggle behavior
userStories.description: As a user, I want to open and close the menu with the hamburger button so that I can access navigation when needed.
acceptance: Clicking hamburger opens closed menu
Clicking hamburger again closes open menu
State is properly managed in Header or parent component
NavigationDropdown receives `isOpen` prop
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Implement click-outside-to-close behavior
userStories.description: As a user, I want the menu to close when I click outside it so that I can easily dismiss it.
acceptance: Clicking outside menu area closes it
Clicking inside menu does not close it
Clicking on nav links closes menu (after navigation)
Uses document click handler or backdrop overlay approach
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Integrate AnnouncementBar into PageLayout
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see the announcement bar on all pages so that I always see current promotions.
acceptance: AnnouncementBar added to `PageLayout.tsx`
Positioned after header, before main content
Example text: 'Free shipping on orders over €50'
Does not interfere with page content layout
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Handle body scroll when menu is open
userStories.description: As a user, I want the page to not scroll when the menu is open so that I can focus on navigation.
acceptance: Body scroll is locked when menu is open (`overflow-hidden` on body)
Scroll is restored when menu closes
Works correctly on navigation (scroll restored)
Uses effect cleanup to ensure scroll is always restored
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)

userStories.title: Remove old Aside mobile menu component
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to remove the old side-drawer menu so that the codebase is clean and there's only one navigation pattern.
acceptance: `MobileMenuAside` removed from `PageLayout.tsx`
Mobile menu type removed from `Aside.tsx` if no longer needed
Cart drawer (if separate) still works
No TypeScript errors
Old side drawer menu no longer appears
Typecheck passes (`pnpm typecheck`)
